column4: hi, which version of the nvidia drivers do i need to run aiglx?
the latest drivers from the website but they are used for aiglx they are used to run beryl on plain xorg
well you need the kernel source to install the nvidia drivers from nvidia website
not the latest drivers ubuntu is using the 8776 drivers
but you can install the nvidia drivers they are in multiverse
i know, bit they are to olt to work with beryl, aren't they? so i tried to install the newer ones, but some of them won't work, some of them are buggy, and some of them won't install...
you need XGL to use the drivers in ubuntu
thats why i tried to install the newer nvidia-drivers
well you can download the linux-source from the repo and get the nvidia driver that way
does the newest one install then?
i need legacy drivers... I've got a Ti4400 but where du i get new ones?
from nvidia website they have legacy drivers as well
1.0-7184??? hell damn it! these are older ones, than i installed? arend there 9xxx supporting the ti4400?
sorry, was that rude? im not that into english ;)
